  16. open Location

  18. (* Docstrings *)

  20. (* A docstring is "attached" if it has been inserted in the AST. This
  21.    is used for generating unexpected docstring warnings. *)
  22. ‌type ds_attached =
  23.   | Unattached   (* Not yet attached anything.*)
  24.   | Info         (* Attached to a field or constructor. *)
  25.   | Docs         (* Attached to an item or as floating text. *)

  27. (* A docstring is "associated" with an item if there are no blank lines between
  28.    them. This is used for generating docstring ambiguity warnings. *)
  29. ‌type ds_associated =
  30.   | Zero             (* Not associated with an item *)
  31.   | One              (* Associated with one item *)
  32.   | Many             (* Associated with multiple items (ambiguity) *)

  34. ‌type docstring =
  35.   { ds_body: string;
  36.     ds_loc: Location.t;
  37.     mutable ds_attached: ds_attached;
  38.     mutable ds_associated: ds_associated; }

  40. (* List of docstrings *)

  42. ‌let docstrings : docstring list ref = ref []

  44. (* Warn for unused and ambiguous docstrings *)

  46. ‌let warn_bad_docstrings () =
  47.   if Warnings.is_active (Warnings.Unexpected_docstring true) then begin
  48.     List.iter
  49.       (fun ds ->
  50.          match ds.ds_attached with
  51.          | Info -> ()
  52.          | Unattached ->
  53.            prerr_warning ds.ds_loc (Warnings.Unexpected_docstring true)
  54.          | Docs ->
  55.              match ds.ds_associated with
  56.              | Zero | One -> ()
  57.              | Many ->
  58.                prerr_warning ds.ds_loc (Warnings.Unexpected_docstring false))
  59.       (List.rev !docstrings)
  60. end

  62. (* Docstring constructors and destructors *)

  64. let docstring body loc =
  65.   let ds =
  66.     { ds_body = body;
  67.       ds_loc = loc;
  68.       ds_attached = Unattached;
  69.       ds_associated = Zero; }
  70.   in
  71.   ds

  73. ‌let register ds =
  74.   docstrings := ds :: !docstrings

  76. ‌let docstring_body ds = ds.ds_body

  78. ‌let docstring_loc ds = ds.ds_loc

  80. (* Docstrings attached to items *)

  82. ‌type docs =
  83.   { docs_pre: docstring option;
  84.     docs_post: docstring option; }

  86. ‌let empty_docs = { docs_pre = None; docs_post = None }

  88. ‌let doc_loc = {txt = "ocaml.doc"; loc = Location.none}

  90. ‌let docs_attr ds =
  91.   let open Parsetree in
  92.   let body = ds.ds_body in
  93.   let loc = ds.ds_loc in
  94.   let exp =
  95.     { pexp_desc = Pexp_constant (Pconst_string(body, loc, None));
  96.       pexp_loc = loc;
  97.       pexp_loc_stack = [];
  98.       pexp_attributes = []; }
  99.   in
  100.   let item =
  101.     { pstr_desc = Pstr_eval (exp, []); pstr_loc = loc }
  102.   in
  103.   { attr_name = doc_loc;
  104.     attr_payload = PStr [item];
  105.     attr_loc = loc }

  107. ‌let add_docs_attrs docs attrs =
  108.   let attrs =
  109.     match docs.docs_pre with
  110.     | None | Some { ds_body=""; _ } -> attrs
  111.     | Some ds -> docs_attr ds :: attrs
  112.   in
  113.   let attrs =
  114.     match docs.docs_post with
  115.     | None | Some { ds_body=""; _ } -> attrs
  116.     | Some ds -> attrs @ [docs_attr ds]
  117.   in
  118.   attrs

  120. (* Docstrings attached to constructors or fields *)

  122. ‌type info = docstring option

  124. ‌let empty_info = None

  126. ‌let info_attr = docs_attr

  128. ‌let add_info_attrs info attrs =
  129.   match info with
  130.   | None | Some {ds_body=""; _} -> attrs
  131.   | Some ds -> attrs @ [info_attr ds]

  133. (* Docstrings not attached to a specific item *)

  135. ‌type text = docstring list

  137. ‌let empty_text = []
  138. ‌let empty_text_lazy = lazy []

  140. ‌let text_loc = {txt = "ocaml.text"; loc = Location.none}

  142. ‌let text_attr ds =
  143.   let open Parsetree in
  144.   let body = ds.ds_body in
  145.   let loc = ds.ds_loc in
  146.   let exp =
  147.     { pexp_desc = Pexp_constant (Pconst_string(body, loc, None));
  148.       pexp_loc = loc;
  149.       pexp_loc_stack = [];
  150.       pexp_attributes = []; }
  151.   in
  152.   let item =
  153.     { pstr_desc = Pstr_eval (exp, []); pstr_loc = loc }
  154.   in
  155.   { attr_name = text_loc;
  156.     attr_payload = PStr [item];
  157.     attr_loc = loc }

  159. ‌let add_text_attrs dsl attrs =
  160.   let fdsl = List.filter (function {ds_body=""} -> false| _ ->true) dsl in
  161.   (List.map text_attr fdsl) @ attrs

  163. (* Find the first non-info docstring in a list, attach it and return it *)
  164. ‌let get_docstring ~info dsl =
  165.   let rec loop = function
  166.     | [] -> None
  167.     | {ds_attached = Info; _} :: rest -> loop rest
  168.     | ds :: _ ->
  169.         ds.ds_attached <- if info then Info else Docs;
  170.         Some ds
  171.   in
  172.   loop dsl

  174. (* Find all the non-info docstrings in a list, attach them and return them *)
  175. ‌let get_docstrings dsl =
  176.   let rec loop acc = function
  177.     | [] -> List.rev acc
  178.     | {ds_attached = Info; _} :: rest -> loop acc rest
  179.     | ds :: rest ->
  180.         ds.ds_attached <- Docs;
  181.         loop (ds :: acc) rest
  182.   in
  183.     loop [] dsl

  185. (* "Associate" all the docstrings in a list *)
  186. ‌let associate_docstrings dsl =
  187.   List.iter
  188.     (fun ds ->
  189.        match ds.ds_associated with
  190.        | Zero -> ds.ds_associated <- One
  191.        | (One | Many) -> ds.ds_associated <- Many)
  192.     dsl

  194. (* Map from positions to pre docstrings *)

  196. let pre_table : (Lexing.position, docstring list) Hashtbl.t =
  197.   Hashtbl.create 50

  199. let set_pre_docstrings pos dsl =
  200.   if dsl <> [] then Hashtbl.add pre_table pos dsl

  202. let get_pre_docs pos =
  203.   try
  204.     let dsl = Hashtbl.find pre_table pos in
  205.       associate_docstrings dsl;
  206.       get_docstring ~info:false dsl
  207.   with Not_found -> None

  209. ‌let mark_pre_docs pos =
  210.   try
  211.     let dsl = Hashtbl.find pre_table pos in
  212.       associate_docstrings dsl
  213.   with Not_found -> ()

  215. (* Map from positions to post docstrings *)

  217. ‌let post_table : (Lexing.position, docstring list) Hashtbl.t =
  218.   Hashtbl.create 50

  220. ‌let set_post_docstrings pos dsl =
  221.   if dsl <> [] then Hashtbl.add post_table pos dsl

  223. ‌let get_post_docs pos =
  224.   try
  225.     let dsl = Hashtbl.find post_table pos in
  226.       associate_docstrings dsl;
  227.       get_docstring ~info:false dsl
  228.   with Not_found -> None

  230. ‌let mark_post_docs pos =
  231.   try
  232.     let dsl = Hashtbl.find post_table pos in
  233.       associate_docstrings dsl
  234.   with Not_found -> ()

  236. ‌let get_info pos =
  237.   try
  238.     let dsl = Hashtbl.find post_table pos in
  239.       get_docstring ~info:true dsl
  240.   with Not_found -> None

  242. (* Map from positions to floating docstrings *)

  244. ‌let floating_table : (Lexing.position, docstring list) Hashtbl.t =
  245.   Hashtbl.create 50

  247. ‌let set_floating_docstrings pos dsl =
  248.   if dsl <> [] then Hashtbl.add floating_table pos dsl

  250. ‌let get_text pos =
  251.   try
  252.     let dsl = Hashtbl.find floating_table pos in
  253.       get_docstrings dsl
  254.   with Not_found -> []

  256. ‌let get_post_text pos =
  257.   try
  258.     let dsl = Hashtbl.find post_table pos in
  259.       get_docstrings dsl
  260.   with Not_found -> []

  262. (* Maps from positions to extra docstrings *)

  264. ‌let pre_extra_table : (Lexing.position, docstring list) Hashtbl.t =
  265.   Hashtbl.create 50

  267. ‌let set_pre_extra_docstrings pos dsl =
  268.   if dsl <> [] then Hashtbl.add pre_extra_table pos dsl

  270. ‌let get_pre_extra_text pos =
  271.   try
  272.     let dsl = Hashtbl.find pre_extra_table pos in
  273.       get_docstrings dsl
  274.   with Not_found -> []

  276. ‌let post_extra_table : (Lexing.position, docstring list) Hashtbl.t =
  277.   Hashtbl.create 50

  279. ‌let set_post_extra_docstrings pos dsl =
  280.   if dsl <> [] then Hashtbl.add post_extra_table pos dsl

  282. ‌let get_post_extra_text pos =
  283.   try
  284.     let dsl = Hashtbl.find post_extra_table pos in
  285.       get_docstrings dsl
  286.   with Not_found -> []

  288. (* Docstrings from parser actions *)
  289. module WithParsing = struct
  290. ‌let symbol_docs () =
  291.   { docs_pre = get_pre_docs (Parsing.symbol_start_pos ());
  292.     docs_post = get_post_docs (Parsing.symbol_end_pos ()); }

  294. ‌let symbol_docs_lazy () =
  295.   let p1 = Parsing.symbol_start_pos () in
  296.   let p2 = Parsing.symbol_end_pos () in
  297.     lazy { docs_pre = get_pre_docs p1;
  298.            docs_post = get_post_docs p2; }

  300. ‌let rhs_docs pos1 pos2 =
  301.   { docs_pre = get_pre_docs (Parsing.rhs_start_pos pos1);
  302.     docs_post = get_post_docs (Parsing.rhs_end_pos pos2); }

  304. ‌let rhs_docs_lazy pos1 pos2 =
  305.   let p1 = Parsing.rhs_start_pos pos1 in
  306.   let p2 = Parsing.rhs_end_pos pos2 in
  307.     lazy { docs_pre = get_pre_docs p1;
  308.            docs_post = get_post_docs p2; }

  310. ‌let mark_symbol_docs () =
  311.   mark_pre_docs (Parsing.symbol_start_pos ());
  312.   mark_post_docs (Parsing.symbol_end_pos ())

  314. ‌let mark_rhs_docs pos1 pos2 =
  315.   mark_pre_docs (Parsing.rhs_start_pos pos1);
  316.   mark_post_docs (Parsing.rhs_end_pos pos2)

  318. ‌let symbol_info () =
  319.   get_info (Parsing.symbol_end_pos ())

  321. ‌let rhs_info pos =
  322.   get_info (Parsing.rhs_end_pos pos)

  324. ‌let symbol_text () =
  325.   get_text (Parsing.symbol_start_pos ())

  327. ‌let symbol_text_lazy () =
  328.   let pos = Parsing.symbol_start_pos () in
  329.     lazy (get_text pos)

  331. ‌let rhs_text pos =
  332.   get_text (Parsing.rhs_start_pos pos)

  334. ‌let rhs_post_text pos =
  335.   get_post_text (Parsing.rhs_end_pos pos)

  337. ‌let rhs_text_lazy pos =
  338.   let pos = Parsing.rhs_start_pos pos in
  339.     lazy (get_text pos)

  341. ‌let symbol_pre_extra_text () =
  342.   get_pre_extra_text (Parsing.symbol_start_pos ())

  344. ‌let symbol_post_extra_text () =
  345.   get_post_extra_text (Parsing.symbol_end_pos ())

  347. ‌let rhs_pre_extra_text pos =
  348.   get_pre_extra_text (Parsing.rhs_start_pos pos)

  350. ‌let rhs_post_extra_text pos =
  351.   get_post_extra_text (Parsing.rhs_end_pos pos)
  352. end

  354. include WithParsing

  356. module WithMenhir = struct
  357. ‌let symbol_docs (startpos, endpos) =
  358.   { docs_pre = get_pre_docs startpos;
  359.     docs_post = get_post_docs endpos; }

  361. ‌let symbol_docs_lazy (p1, p2) =
  362.   lazy { docs_pre = get_pre_docs p1;
  363.          docs_post = get_post_docs p2; }

  365. ‌let rhs_docs pos1 pos2 =
  366.   { docs_pre = get_pre_docs pos1;
  367.     docs_post = get_post_docs pos2; }

  369. ‌let rhs_docs_lazy p1 p2 =
  370.     lazy { docs_pre = get_pre_docs p1;
  371.            docs_post = get_post_docs p2; }

  373. ‌let mark_symbol_docs (startpos, endpos) =
  374.   mark_pre_docs startpos;
  375.   mark_post_docs endpos;
  376.   ()

  378. ‌let mark_rhs_docs pos1 pos2 =
  379.   mark_pre_docs pos1;
  380.   mark_post_docs pos2;
  381.   ()

  383. ‌let symbol_info endpos =
  384.   get_info endpos

  386. ‌let rhs_info endpos =
  387.   get_info endpos

  389. ‌let symbol_text startpos =
  390.   get_text startpos

  392. ‌let symbol_text_lazy startpos =
  393.   lazy (get_text startpos)

  395. ‌let rhs_text pos =
  396.   get_text pos

  398. ‌let rhs_post_text pos =
  399.   get_post_text pos

  401. ‌let rhs_text_lazy pos =
  402.   lazy (get_text pos)

  404. ‌let symbol_pre_extra_text startpos =
  405.   get_pre_extra_text startpos

  407. ‌let symbol_post_extra_text endpos =
  408.   get_post_extra_text endpos

  410. ‌let rhs_pre_extra_text pos =
  411.   get_pre_extra_text pos

  413. ‌let rhs_post_extra_text pos =
  414.   get_post_extra_text pos
  415. end

  417. (* (Re)Initialise all comment state *)

  419. ‌let init () =
  420.   docstrings := [];
  421.   Hashtbl.reset pre_table;
  422.   Hashtbl.reset post_table;
  423.   Hashtbl.reset floating_table;
  424.   Hashtbl.reset pre_extra_table;
  425.   Hashtbl.reset post_extra_table
